Concentration name: Financial Reporting and Assurance; Taxation
description: Our Master of Accountancy (MAcc) program prepares students for a variety of careers in accounting, including public accounting, corporate accounting, and governmental accounting. The program also fulfills the 150-hour requirement to sit for the CPA exam in Kansas and most other states.
Accreditation status: The Department of Accounting holds separate accreditation from the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business (AACSB) International.

description: The adult learning and leadership programs offer graduate degrees and certificates for professionals working in a wide variety of contexts including: Adult basic education, Community colleges, Community-based organizations, Cooperative Extension, Corporate training and development, Healthcare education, Higher education, Human resource development, Military education, Religious organizations, Undergraduate and graduate education. Our programs are designed to help you integrate theory and practice to become a more effective educator, trainer, leader, or program planner.

The Master of Agribusiness (MAB) is an award-winning, distance education graduate degree program that focuses on food, animal health and agribusiness management. This program is not an MBA in agribusiness, and it is not an M.S. in Agricultural Economics. It is a professional degree program aimed at training managers for one of the most rapidly changing industries in the world. The MAB program is a flexible, hybrid program designed for working professionals.

The graduate certificate in agricultural education is designed for individuals seeking to obtain licensure to teach agriculture at the secondary level (6-12) in Kansas. This certificate is designed for those who have already completed a Bachelor of Science degree in an agriculture field (animal science, agronomy, horticulture, ag economics, ag communications, etc.) and have a desire to teach agricultural education. This certificate entails 20 hours of graduate coursework in the College of Agriculture and the College of Education at Kansas State University.
Program name: Agricultural and Extension Education and Communication

description: The Master of Science in Agricultural Economics provides a rigorous curriculum and allows students the flexibility to focus on specific career goals. The program prepares students for a career in the private and public sectors, including agribusiness, banking, government, or for Ph.D. programs. Students work closely with faculty experts in these areas to complete a research-based thesis or a coursework-focused degree.

The Department of Communications and Agricultural Education provides a Master of Science degree in agricultural education and communication. The program is designed to prepare graduates for teaching, research, extension, administrative, and leadership positions in the public and private sectors. Courses in the program focus on agricultural education, agricultural communication, extension education, and leadership.

Concentration name: Agricultural Meteorology; Crop Ecology; Crop Physiology and Production; Environmental Quality; Pasture Management; Plant Breeding and Genetics; Soil Chemistry; Soil Fertility and Nutrient Management; Soil Management and Water Quality; Soil Microbiology; Soil Physics; Weed Science
description: The graduate program in the Department of Agronomy at Kansas State University provides an opportunity for students to not only study with world-class scientists but to conduct their research in state-of-the-art facilities. Students are prepared for careers in research, teaching, extension, industry, and farming. The department offers the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees in Agronomy.

The graduate program in the Department of Anatomy and Physiology leads to the Master of Science (MS) and Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) degrees. The program is flexible and accommodates students with diverse interests in Cell and Developmental Biology, Neuroscience, Physiology/Pharmacology, and Gross Anatomy/Histology. Graduate study in the Department of Anatomy and Physiology includes a rigorous curriculum in the basic medical sciences and extensive training in experimental design and methodology.

The graduate program in Animal Sciences and Industry is a comprehensive program of graduate study leading to M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in Animal Science and Food Science. The program has a diverse faculty and excellent research facilities to support graduate student learning. We offer a broad variety of research areas including: Breeding and Genetics, Food Science, Meat Science, Monogastric Nutrition, Physiology, Product Development and Management, Ruminant Nutrition.

The Anthropology Program offers a Master of Arts degree in Anthropology. We are a four-field department with strengths in cultural anthropology, biological anthropology, linguistic anthropology, and archaeology. We prepare students for doctoral programs in anthropology and related fields and for careers in government, museums, and the private sector. The small size of our program (typically 4-8 students per cohort) allows us to offer close mentorship and generous financial support to our graduate students.

description: The applied family science master’s degree is a 36-credit-hour program offered online through the Great Plains Interactive Distance Education Alliance (Great Plains IDEA). The program focuses on the study of family dynamics, family policy and family life education. Students will learn to serve families in a variety of contexts and settings.
Accreditation status: The Kansas State University applied family science master's program is approved by the National Council on Family Relations (NCFR).

description: The master of science in architectural engineering (M.S.) is offered through the architectural engineering program in the Department of Architectural Engineering and Construction Science. The M.S. degree requires research in an area of specialization, notably building electrical systems, building mechanical systems, building structural systems, or building construction management.

The Master of Architecture (M. Arch) is a STEM designated program directed towards the professional practice of architecture. Design theory, history, technology, and practice are taught in the context of the design studio. The program provides opportunities for students to engage in the design of buildings and settlements, and the understanding of the environmental, social, and cultural contexts of design. The program is organized as a 5-year track for students entering from high school with no background in design. A post-baccalaureate track is available for students with a baccalaureate degree. Students in the program are required to have a laptop computer.
Accreditation status: The Kansas State University Department of Architecture offers the following NAAB-accredited degree program: M. Arch. (non-baccalaureate master’s degree – 170 credits). Next accreditation visit: 2026

Concentration name: Graphic design, ceramics, digital/experimental media, drawing, metalsmithing and jewelry, painting, photography and printmaking
description: The Master of Fine Arts degree is the terminal degree in studio arts. The program at Kansas State University requires a three-year residency and 90 credit hours. The major objective of the M.F.A. is to prepare students for professional careers in the visual arts, including the teaching of art in higher education.
Accreditation status: The Department of Art is an accredited institutional member of the National Association of Schools of Art and Design (NASAD).

error: Invalid operation: The `response.text` quick accessor requires the response to contain a valid `Part`, but none were returned. The candidate's [finish_reason](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#finishreason) is 1.

description: Graduate work in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics leads to the degrees of master of science and doctor of philosophy. The department has a long tradition of excellence in research and provides a supportive environment for graduate students. The faculty are dynamic and well-funded. The program is highly interdisciplinary with strong connections to the Departments of Chemistry, Physics, Biology, Plant Pathology, Grain Science, Animal Science and Anatomy and Physiology. The program is an active member of several interdisciplinary groups, including the Arthropod Genomics Center, the Konza Prairie LTER, the Center for NASA Experimental Program to Stimulate Competitive Research, or EPSCoR, and the Johnson Center for Basic Cancer Research.

The graduate program in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics is a rigorous, yet flexible, course of study designed to provide students with the training and expertise necessary to pursue a career in the field of biochemistry and molecular biophysics. The program offers both M.S. and Ph.D. degrees.

The Graduate Certificate in Bioinformatics is an interdisciplinary program that offers an opportunity for current graduate students and professionals to gain recognition for their bioinformatics skills. The certificate is open to degree-seeking graduate students at Kansas State University and non-degree students.

The Carl and Melinda Helwig Department of Biological and Agricultural Engineering offers a Master of Science and a Doctor of Philosophy in Biological and Agricultural Engineering. Our graduate program is consistently ranked among the top programs in the nation by U.S. News & World Report. We offer a stimulating and supportive environment for students to pursue their research interests and professional goals. Students work closely with faculty members on cutting-edge research projects that address global challenges in food, energy, water, and the environment.

The Division of Biology offers a Graduate Program leading to the Master of Science and Doctor of Philosophy degrees. Research areas include cell biology, developmental biology, ecology, evolution, genetics, genomics, immunology, microbiology, physiology, virology, and wildlife biology.

The Master of Science in Biomedical Science (MSBS) is a full-time, one-year master’s program designed to prepare students for professional school (veterinary, medical, dental, etc.) or a career in the biomedical sciences. The curriculum provides a broad background in the biomedical sciences, including anatomy, physiology, histology, immunology, and pharmacology.

This program is designed for laboratory personnel, military personnel, and law enforcement and first responders who may have to deal with biosecurity issues. This certificate provides an interdisciplinary curriculum that focuses on the protection of the U.S. food supply and agricultural economy from accidental or intentional contamination or destruction. This certificate serves the needs of graduate students and qualified professionals who need specialized education in biosecurity and biodefense.

The College of Business Administration offers high-quality graduate business programs for students who want to advance their careers and their earning potential. Our graduate programs include the Master of Business Administration (MBA), Master of Accountancy (MAcc), Master of Science in Data Analytics (MSDA) and several graduate certificates. We also offer a Ph.D. in Business Administration with concentrations in marketing, management and finance.
Accreditation status: AACSB Accredited

description: The Tim Taylor Department of Chemical Engineering is a vibrant place for graduate study and research. We have 17 faculty members with expertise in areas such as advanced materials, bio-based products and bio-energy, biomolecular engineering, catalysis and reaction engineering, computational engineering, environmental engineering, semiconductor materials, sustainable energy, and transport phenomena. We offer programs of study leading to the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. The M.S. program is designed to prepare students for advanced roles in the chemical process industry or for further graduate study. The Ph.D. program is designed to prepare students for careers in industrial research and development or in academic research and teaching.

Our graduate program offers M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in Chemistry. We have a vibrant and diverse department with roughly 70 graduate students and 15 faculty members. Research opportunities exist in analytical, inorganic, organic, and physical chemistry, as well as in chemical education. The Department of Chemistry offers a stimulating intellectual environment and an excellent community for your graduate studies. We offer a highly collaborative environment with research groups often working together on interdisciplinary projects.

Concentration name: environmental, geotechnical, structural, transportation and water resources engineering
description: The Department of Civil Engineering offers graduate programs leading to the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. Advanced study can be pursued in environmental, geotechnical, structural, transportation and water resources engineering. Students are prepared for careers in the private and public sectors, including consulting, government agencies, and industry, as well as in research and education institutions.

Concentration name: College Student Development Administration; College Student Development Intercollegiate Athletics
description: The Master of Science in College Student Development (CSD) at Kansas State University prepares students to work in Student Affairs or similar units in higher education. The program is designed to integrate coursework with practical experience to prepare students to be effective practitioners. We are committed to social justice, equity, and inclusion, and we strive to create a learning environment that affirms the dignity of all individuals.

The M.A. in Communication Studies at Kansas State University is a generalist degree designed to provide students with a broad theoretical and methodological foundation in the discipline. Our program is small and selective, allowing for close mentorship between faculty and students. Our faculty conduct research and teach in two primary areas: Relational and Organizational Communication, and Rhetoric and Political Communication. Students are encouraged to take classes in both areas to gain a comprehensive understanding of human communication. The program prepares students for doctoral study or for professional careers in business, non-profit organizations, government, and education.

The community development master's degree is a collaborative program offered through the Great Plains Interactive Distance Education Alliance (Great Plains IDEA). It is a diverse, online curriculum designed to meet the needs of those currently working in the community development field or those wishing to embark on a new career path. Community development is about building the capacity of people to improve their quality of life. The practice of community development allows us to act collectively and responsibly to foster social, economic, physical and environmental well-being.
Accreditation status: Kansas State University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.

error: Invalid operation: The `response.text` quick accessor requires the response to contain a valid `Part`, but none were returned. The candidate's [finish_reason](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#finishreason) is 1.

description: The Department of Computer Science offers graduate programs leading to the Master of Science (MS) and Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) degrees. The master's degree program offers thesis, report, and non-thesis options. The doctoral program is a research-oriented degree designed to prepare students for advanced research or university teaching. Our faculty members are active in research, and the department has strong research programs in the following areas: Cyber security, Cyber physical systems, High performance computing, Artificial intelligence and data science, Software engineering.

The Conflict Analysis and Trauma Studies (CATS) Program prepares students to recognize, deal with, and assess the effects of trauma resulting from conflict and violence. It is designed to assist professionals in the military, intelligence, diplomatic, and humanitarian communities to better understand the psychological and social impact of the environments in which they operate.

The K-State Conflict Resolution Program offers distinct Undergraduate and Graduate Certificates in Conflict Resolution. Our courses help students improve their communication skills, become effective negotiators, and learn how to mediate conflict. Conflict resolution skills are essential for professional success and personal growth. The certificates are open to students of all majors and are designed to complement any degree program.

The Ph.D. in counseling and student development prepares you for a career as a counselor educator, supervisor, researcher or advanced practitioner in academic and clinical settings. This program is for students who have completed a master's degree in counseling or a related field. The program is designed to provide you with advanced preparation in counseling, supervision, teaching, research and leadership.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Council for Accreditation of Counseling and Related Educational Programs (CACREP)

description: The Couple and Family Therapy (CFT) program at Kansas State University prepares clinicians and scholars to work in academic, clinical, policy, and research settings. The program is dedicated to the recruitment, retention, and graduation of diverse students. We strive to provide a safe and affirming environment for all students, faculty, and staff.
Accreditation status: The M.S. and Ph.D. programs are accredited by the Commission on Accreditation for Marriage and Family Therapy Education (COAMFTE).

Concentration name: Creative Writing
description: The Master of Arts track in creative writing offers students the opportunity to develop their writing in workshops and forms classes, and to work one-on-one with faculty mentors, leading to a final M.A. thesis, a book-length manuscript of poems, stories, or essays. Our graduate faculty are active, publishing writers who are committed to their students’ work. We encourage students to read widely and deeply; our program requires literature courses as well as writing workshops. We offer workshops in fiction, poetry, and creative nonfiction.

The Department of Curriculum and Instruction offers undergraduate and graduate programs as well as a variety of professional development opportunities. We prepare educators to be knowledgeable, ethical, and caring decision makers who demonstrate knowledge of the learner, content, and pedagogy; use this knowledge to facilitate and assess learning for all students; and exemplify professionalism.

Cybersecurity is a critical issue for companies and individuals. As technology advances, the demand for computer science graduates who are educated in cybersecurity issues is growing rapidly. This certificate program will help students gain knowledge of the issues involved in cybersecurity and the skills necessary to protect networks and systems.

Concentration name: Business Analytics, Computer Science, Economics, Geospatial Analysis, Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering, Mathematics, Social Science Analysis, Statistics/Data Science
description: Data analytics is the science of analyzing raw data in order to make conclusions about that information. Many of the techniques and processes of data analytics have been automated into mechanical processes and algorithms that work over raw data for human consumption. The data analytics program at K-State is an interdisciplinary undergraduate degree program that offers courses in computer science, mathematics, statistics, and business to give students the tools they need to be successful in data-driven industries.

The Department of Diagnostic Medicine/Pathobiology offers a program of graduate study leading to the Master of Science degree (M.S.). The M.S. degree is awarded in Veterinary Biomedical Science. Areas of emphasis include but are not limited to: infectious diseases, bacteriology, virology, molecular biology, immunology, parasitology, epidemiology, toxicology, and pathology. The M.S. degree is a broad-based degree program involving course work and research training. It is designed to prepare students for employment in academia, government, and industry or for further training in a Ph.D. or DVM/Ph.D. program.

The online dietetics bachelor's degree provides the academic requirements to become a registered dietitian nutritionist (RDN). The program curriculum focuses on the science of food and nutrition, management of foodservice systems, and medical nutrition therapy.
Accreditation status: K-State's dietetics program is a Didactic Program in Dietetics (DPD) approved by the Accreditation Council for Education in Nutrition and Dietetics (ACEND).

Concentration name: Drama Therapy
description: Kansas State University offers an MA in Theatre with a concentration in drama therapy. Drama therapy is an active, experiential approach to facilitating change. Through storytelling, projective play, purposeful improvisation, and performance, participants are invited to rehearse desired behaviors, practice being in relationship, expand and find flexibility between life roles, and perform the change they wish to see and be in the world.
Accreditation status: The program is accredited by the National Association of Schools of Theatre (NAST) and meets the academic requirements for the Registered Drama Therapist (RDT) credential from the North American Drama Therapy Association (NADTA).

Concentration name: Early Childhood Education
description: This program is designed for students who work with children ages birth through 8 (or 3rd grade) and/or their families. Students may choose to focus on administration, teaching, or family studies. The program provides advanced study for teachers and other professionals who work with young children and their families. This program is offered entirely online.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Kansas State Department of Education and the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

Concentration name: Econometrics; Industrial Organization; International Economics; Labor Economics; Macroeconomics; Public Economics; Regional Economics
description: The Ph.D. program in Economics at Kansas State University offers a broad background in economic theory and econometrics and an opportunity to specialize in two fields. The low student-faculty ratio allows for close interaction between students and faculty. The program structure is designed to provide students with the necessary tools to conduct original research.

Concentration name: Adult Learning and Leadership; Academic Advising; Counseling and Student Development; Curriculum and Instruction; Educational Leadership; Special Education; Master of Arts in Teaching
description: Our graduate programs are designed to prepare you for leadership roles in schools, colleges, and communities. You will have the opportunity to work with world-class faculty who are dedicated to your success. We offer a variety of programs to meet your needs, including online, on-campus, and hybrid options.
Accreditation status: Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Kansas State Department of Education (KSDE)

description: The Department of Educational Leadership prepares scholarly practitioners and focuses on the interplay of theory and practice. We offer graduate degrees in Adult Learning and Leadership, Community College Leadership, Educational Leadership, and Student Affairs in Higher Education. Our programs are designed to serve the needs of working professionals.
Accreditation status: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Kansas State Department of Education (KSDE).

description: The Mike Wiegers Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering offers graduate work leading to the Master of Science and Doctor of Philosophy degrees. Research is conducted in the following areas: Bio-medical and health informatics; Communications and Networking; Computer Engineering; Control Systems; Power and Energy Systems; Systems Biology; and VLSI and Embedded Systems design.

The Mike Wiegers Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering offers a Master of Science degree in electrical and computer engineering. The master’s program offers a thesis option and a coursework-only option. Students in the program can focus their studies in the following areas: Bioengineering, Communications and Signal Processing, Computer Engineering, Controls and Robotics, Electronics and Integrated Circuits, Power Systems and Energy, Systems.

Concentration name: Curriculum and Instruction, Educational Technology, English as a Second Language, Learning Skills/School Improvement, Literacy, Mathematics Education, Reading Specialist, Science Education, Social Science Education, Social Studies Education
description: The Master of Science in Elementary Education is a graduate degree program designed for those who have already completed a bachelor’s degree in Elementary Education (or related field). It is not for initial licensure. This advanced degree is a 30-36 credit hour program that allows you to dive deep in curriculum and instruction and specialize in an area of interest.

Concentration name: Aerospace engineering, Biological and agricultural engineering, Chemical engineering, Civil engineering, Computer science, Electrical and computer engineering, Industrial engineering, Mechanical engineering, Nuclear engineering
description: The Doctor of Philosophy in engineering is a single degree with areas of specialization in aerospace engineering, biological and agricultural engineering, chemical engineering, civil engineering, computer science, electrical and computer engineering, industrial engineering, mechanical engineering and nuclear engineering. This unique program offers the advantage of a major in a specific engineering discipline while simultaneously providing the opportunity for multi-disciplinary research. It is designed to meet the needs of the practicing engineer.

The Master of Engineering Management, or MEM, is a professional degree designed for engineers and scientists interested in the skills necessary to manage people, projects and resources in technical environments. It is the only degree of its kind offered in Kansas. This program helps you bridge the gap between engineering and business.

Concentration name: Literature; Children's Literature; Composition and Rhetoric; Creative Writing; Cultural Studies
description: The Department of English offers a Master of Arts degree in English. Students may choose among five tracks: Literature, Children's Literature, Creative Writing, Cultural Studies, and Composition and Rhetoric. The M.A. program provides students with a strong foundation in literary and cultural studies, writing, and research, preparing them for doctoral study or for careers in teaching, editing, publishing, and other fields.

The Department of Entomology offers graduate work leading to the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. The staff and facilities of the Department are well qualified to direct study and research in the following areas: arthropod pest management, biological control, chemical ecology, ecology, extension entomology, genetics, host plant resistance, medical/veterinary entomology, molecular biology, physiology, systematics, and toxicology.

The Doctor of Philosophy in Environmental Design and Planning is an interdisciplinary program offered by the College of Architecture, Planning & Design at Kansas State University. The program provides advanced education to students who wish to pursue careers in research, teaching, and/or practice in the fields of architecture, interior architecture, industrial design, landscape architecture, and regional and community planning. The Ph.D. program is dedicated to the creation, understanding, and stewardship of the built and natural environments.

The environmental engineering program is a graduate-level program that leads to the Master of Science in environmental engineering. The program is part of the civil engineering department.

Environmental engineering is a broad field of study that focuses on chemicals and microorganisms in the environment and how these relate to human health and the ecological wellbeing. The environmental engineering program provides opportunities to study in the areas of water and wastewater treatment, environmental chemistry, sustainability, and air quality. The program also provides opportunities to study complex environmental problems that cross traditional boundaries including agricultural and chemical engineering, agronomy, biology and chemistry.

Evolutionary biology is the subfield of biology that studies the evolutionary processes that produced the diversity of life on Earth starting from a single origin of life. These processes include natural selection, common descent, and speciation.

The family and community services online master's degree covers a broad scope of family topics and is largely defined by the student's interests. The program focuses on the development and implementation of public, private and voluntary support services for individuals, families and localities and prepares individuals to function in a variety of occupations promoting family life and family/community well-being.

The graduate certificate in personal financial planning is registered with the Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards Inc., and the courses are approved by the CFP Board. The program consists of 18 credit hours and is designed for students who already have a degree and are interested in the body of knowledge specified by the Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards in a credit format. Students who complete the graduate certificate program will be eligible to sit for the CFP® Certification Examination.
Accreditation status: Registered with the Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards Inc., and the courses are approved by the CFP Board.

description: The graduate certificate in financial therapy provides a specific focus on the therapeutic aspect of financial counseling and planning. You will gain knowledge and skills to help others feel less stress and more confidence when it comes to their finances. Through the 12-credit hour program, you will study the intersection of money, relationships and psychology. This program is designed for financial professionals who want to help clients repair and maintain healthy financial lives.
Accreditation status: Kansas State University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission of the North Central Association of Colleges and Schools.

description: Kansas State University’s food safety and defense graduate certificate program offers an interdisciplinary curriculum that includes courses from animal sciences and industry, food science, and diagnostic medicine/pathobiology. This program provides broad-based expertise in food safety and defense to professionals working in the food industry. Food safety is a critical component of the food supply chain, and as the global food market continues to expand, the need for skilled professionals in this area is growing. Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of the biological and chemical hazards that affect food safety, as well as the regulations and policies that govern the food industry. The curriculum covers topics such as food microbiology, toxicology, epidemiology, and risk assessment.
Accreditation status: Kansas State University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.

Concentration name: Food Chemistry, Food Microbiology, Food Safety, Sensory Analysis, Food Processing/Engineering, Grain Science, Pet Food
description: The Food Science Institute at Kansas State University offers a truly interdisciplinary graduate program with faculty in 5 colleges and 11 departments. Our diverse faculty allow students to gain expertise in the basic sciences as well as applied food science. Our program offers Masters and Doctorate degrees in Food Science.

The Graduate Certificate in Gender, Women, and Sexuality Studies is designed for students who wish to pursue interdisciplinary work in this field, but who are unable to satisfy all requirements for a master's or doctoral degree. The certificate proves that a student has completed a course of study in Gender, Women, and Sexuality Studies. It creates a specific credential that is useful in employment applications and can also be applied toward a graduate degree. The certificate is offered by the Gender, Women, and Sexuality Studies Department in the College of Arts and Sciences.

The genetics program is an interdepartmental, interdisciplinary degree program focused on studying the basic principles of genetics and the application of these principles in a variety of organisms including plants, animals, insects, nematodes, fungi and bacteria. The program is broad in scope and includes faculty from the Division of Biology and the departments of Agronomy, Animal Sciences and Industry, Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics, Entomology, Horticulture and Natural Resources, Plant Pathology, and Statistics. Research in the program involves a large variety of experimental approaches, including biochemical, cellular, developmental, molecular, physiological, quantitative and statistical. Research facilities include the Genomic Facility, the Confocal Microscopy Facility, the Plant Biotechnology Center, the Wheat Genetic and Genomic Resource Center, the Arthropod Genomics Center and the Konza Prairie Research Natural Area.

The Department of Geography at Kansas State University is a doctoral program with a strong research orientation. We offer M.A. and Ph.D. degrees in Geography. Our faculty and graduate students conduct research in four main areas: Environmental Geography, Geographic Information Science, Human Geography, and Physical Geography.

The Department of Geology offers a program leading to the Master of Science degree. Students may select a thesis or coursework option. The thesis option requires 30 credit hours, including 6 to 10 research credit hours. The coursework option requires 30 credit hours. Current research strengths in the department include composition and evolution of the sub-continental lithospheric mantle; environmental geochemistry of surficial processes; geologic hazards, including volcanoes and earthquakes; hydrogeology and water resources; petroleum geology and sedimentary basins; and tectonics and structural geology.

The Center on Aging offers a 36-hour Master of Science in Gerontology through the Great Plains Interactive Distance Education Alliance (Great Plains IDEA). This online program allows you to earn a degree from Kansas State University while enjoying the flexibility of learning from home. This program is designed for students who are working directly with older people or are involved in education or research related to aging.

The Department of Grain Science and Industry offers graduate programs leading to the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees in Grain Science. Our graduate program offers students the opportunity to undertake research in cereal chemistry, grain science, and grain processing. We have outstanding research facilities and our faculty are recognized world-wide as experts in their respective fields. Students with a Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree in biological, physical, or agricultural sciences, or in chemical, food, or agricultural engineering are well prepared to enter the graduate program.

The grassland management graduate certificate creates a unique opportunity for you to specialize in the conservation and utilization of grassland resources. The program brings together some of the most notable grassland management faculty in the nation. This 12-credit hour program is offered through the AG*IDEA (Agriculture Interactive Distance Education Alliance). Courses are taught by faculty from Kansas State University, Oklahoma State University, South Dakota State University and the University of Nebraska-Lincoln.
Accreditation status: Kansas State University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.

description: Welcome to Graduate Studies in History at Kansas State University! We are a dynamic community of scholars committed to the study of the past. We offer M.A. and Ph.D. degrees to a diverse student body, including serving officers in the US military. We have particular strengths in military history, agricultural/environmental history, and religious history, as well as American history (all eras), early modern and modern Europe, and East Asian history. Our graduate faculty are active researchers and dedicated teachers.

Graduate programs in horticulture offer the opportunity to conduct applied or basic research in the production, management and utilization of horticultural crops. Areas of specialization include fruit or vegetable crops, turfgrass management, woody or herbaceous ornamentals, plant breeding/genetics, plant stress physiology, controlled environment horticulture, postharvest physiology and weed science. The department offers a Master of Science and a Doctor of Philosophy.

Concentration name: Urban Food Systems
description: The horticulture with an emphasis in urban food systems master's degree is a professional degree program focused on how the food system impacts community economic development. The curriculum provides a deep look at the science of horticulture and food crops and how they are grown, produced and consumed in an urban environment.
Accreditation status: Kansas State University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.
Program name: Horticulture with an emphasis in Urban Food Systems

description: The Hospitality Administration graduate program prepares students for research, teaching, and administrative positions in universities and colleges, as well as for management positions in the hospitality industry. The program has a strong reputation for research and scholarship, and the faculty are active in professional organizations and editorial boards.

The human-computer interaction, or HCI, graduate certificate program offers students the opportunity to learn the critical skills needed to effectively design and evaluate websites and other technology, as well as study the impact of technology on its users.

The IMSE department offers graduate study leading to the Master of Science, Master of Engineering Management, and Doctor of Philosophy degrees. The Master of Science degree is available in industrial engineering and operations research. The Master of Engineering Management is a professional degree for those managing engineering projects and personnel. The Doctor of Philosophy degree is available in industrial engineering.

This graduate certificate program provides students with an in-depth understanding of the major infectious disease threats to domestic animal species. The curriculum covers the etiology, pathology, epidemiology, diagnosis, treatment and control of important infectious diseases. This program is designed for students who want to increase their knowledge in infectious diseases of animals and prepare for a career in animal health, veterinary medicine, or related fields.

The Department of Computer Science offers a Graduate Certificate in Information Security and Assurance. This certificate program is designed for technical professionals and graduate students who want to qualify for positions involving the security of computer systems. Students in the program will learn: Cryptographic techniques; Formal models of security and assurance; Security protocols; Authentication; Operating systems security; Computer viruses and malware; Network security; Information warfare.

The M.S. in instructional design and technology program is designed for professionals preparing for careers in the design and development of education and training resources. Students learn to apply the principles of instructional design, learning theory and technology integration to the design of educational materials and environments. Graduates of this program work in K-12 education, higher education, corporate, government and military settings.

error: Invalid operation: The `response.text` quick accessor requires the response to contain a valid `Part`, but none were returned. The candidate's [finish_reason](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#finishreason) is 1.

description: The Master of Interior Architecture & Product Design (MIAPD) is a first-professional degree, accredited by the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA), created specifically for students that do not have a background in interior design, interior architecture, or architecture. This program gives you the opportunity to pursue an interior design career while drawing from your undergraduate discipline. The 87 credit hour curriculum is a three-year (+summer) program and begins the summer immediately following your acceptance. Our students are designing the future. Through our curriculum, you will learn to tackle the design of the immediate interior environment to not only consider aesthetics but to shape the user experience. We are designers of products, furniture, interior spaces, and architecture.
Accreditation status: accredited by the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA)

description: The A.Q. Miller School of Media and Communication offers a Master of Science in mass communications. We have a flexible curriculum that allows students to focus on areas such as strategic communication, journalism, and media research. The program is designed for both professionals and those who want to pursue a Ph.D.
Accreditation status: Accrediting Council on Education in Journalism and Mass Communications (ACEJMC)

Concentration name: K-12 School Leadership
description: This program prepares dynamic, high-quality leaders for positions in elementary, middle and high schools. The program results in a Master of Science degree in educational leadership and eligibility for Kansas building leadership licensure.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Kansas State Department of Education (KSDE) and the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

description: The Department of Kinesiology offers graduate work leading to the Master of Science and Doctor of Philosophy degrees. Areas of emphasis include: Exercise Behavioral Science, Exercise Physiology, Public Health Physical Activity.

Landscape architecture is a professional design discipline that addresses the built and natural environments. We design parks, communities, streetscapes, plazas and green roofs. We also work at the scale of the city and region, dealing with large and complex systems—from ecological infrastructure to community planning. Our accredited Master of Landscape Architecture program is a STEM-designated program. We prepare graduates for professional licensure and practice in the private and public sectors. We teach students to be critical thinkers and creative designers.
Accreditation status: Our accredited Master of Landscape Architecture program is a STEM-designated program.

description: The doctoral program in Leadership Communication prepares leaders to address complex community issues through community-engaged research and teaching. This interdisciplinary degree is designed for individuals seeking to advance their careers in higher education, non-profit organizations, and public service.

The doctoral program in leadership communication is a research-based degree that prepares you for academic teaching, research, and senior-level administrative roles. An interdisciplinary degree, the program combines leadership and communication studies to help students conduct high-quality research and gain expertise in the study of leadership. Our collaborative faculty offer a unique opportunity to study leadership communication in varying contexts including health, political, organizational, community, and executive leadership.

The interdisciplinary life sciences program offers research training that leads to the Ph.D. in life sciences. The primary objective is to recruit and train students for careers in the growing life sciences sectors of the higher education and economy. Our program offers students the opportunity to choose from a wide variety of research topics. These include basic and translational research in the following areas: Animal Sciences and Industry, Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics, Biology, Entomology, Grain Science and Industry, Horticulture and Natural Resources, Kinesiology, Plant Pathology, Psychological Sciences.

The graduate certificate in literacy education provides an interdisciplinary understanding of the role of literacy in a democracy to meet the needs of an increasingly diverse student population. This 15-credit hour graduate certificate is designed for teachers who wish to understand the complex and dynamic nature of literacy instruction and to implement a responsive, research-based curriculum for all students.
Accreditation status: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Kansas State Department of Education (KSDE).

Concentration name: Leadership in Communication
description: The Ph.D. in Mass Communications with a concentration in Leadership in Communication is an academic doctorate that produces students who are prepared to create and implement solutions to the strategic communication and leadership challenges that organizations face. The program’s curriculum is designed to help students become strategic leaders in their organizations and communities, capable of using communication to identify and address complex problems. Graduates are also prepared for academic careers in research and teaching.

The Department of Mathematics at Kansas State University offers a robust graduate program leading to the Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) and Master of Science (M.S.) degrees. Our program has about 55 graduate students and 30 graduate faculty researchers. We have a very active seminar schedule and a rich variety of coursework. Research strengths include analysis, algebra, geometry/topology, and applied mathematics/mathematical physics/harmonic analysis.

The Alan Levin Department of Mechanical and Nuclear Engineering offers separate graduate programs in mechanical engineering and nuclear engineering. Both programs offer the master of science and doctor of philosophy degrees. Our graduate programs are designed to provide students with the technical expertise and critical thinking skills necessary to solve complex engineering problems and to pursue careers in academia, industry, or government. The department has a strong research focus with significant funding from federal agencies and industry.

The Microbiology Graduate Program is an interdisciplinary program administered by the Division of Biology and the Department of Diagnostic Medicine and Pathobiology. Our faculty members have diverse research interests, including genetics and physiology of microorganisms, virology, immunology, pathogenesis, host-pathogen interactions, epidemiology and ecology, and microbial genomics. The program offers study for M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in Microbiology.

Concentration name: French; German; Spanish; Second Language Acquisition/Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL)
description: The M.A. in Modern Languages provides students with a graduate-level understanding of the literature, culture, and language of their chosen area of specialization. It prepares students for doctoral study, for teaching careers, or for professional positions in international business, government, and other fields. The program offers a thesis and a non-thesis option.

Concentration name: Composition; Conducting; Music Education; Music History/Literature; Pedagogy; Performance
description: The Master of Music degree at Kansas State University offers students the opportunity to study with a distinguished faculty of scholars and performers. The program is designed to allow students to develop their professional musical competence and to prepare them for doctoral study or for employment in the field of music. The Master of Music degree requires a minimum of 30-32 semester hours of credit. Candidates for the degree must perform a public recital or submit a thesis or original composition.
Accreditation status: National Association of Schools of Music (NASM)

Concentration name: Nuclear Option
description: The Nuclear Option of the M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in mechanical engineering allows students to specifically focus on research in nuclear engineering. This option is available for graduate students who wish to pursue a nuclear engineering focus.

The Department of Food, Nutrition, Dietetics and Health offers a graduate program leading to the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees in Nutrition, Dietetics and Sensory Sciences. The graduate program provides advanced training in basic and applied research in the areas of: Nutritional Sciences, Public Health Nutrition, Sensory Analysis and Consumer Behavior.

The 15-credit hour graduate certificate in one health recognizes that the health of people, animals and the environment are connected. As human populations grow and expand into new geographic areas, we share our environment with more animals. These changes have linked the spread of diseases among animals and people. The program is designed for students and professionals who want to gain a broad perspective on the interdisciplinary nature of health and be better prepared to work in the field of One Health.

The Master of Science in Operations Research (MSOR) is an interdisciplinary graduate degree program in the Department of Industrial and Manufacturing Systems Engineering at Kansas State University. This program is designed for professionals and graduates with backgrounds in engineering, mathematics, statistics, or physical sciences who wish to develop expertise in operations research.

The PhD program in Pathobiology is a departmental program. Students in the Pathobiology PhD program will be matched with a Major Professor from the DMP graduate faculty. The Supervisory Committee and the student will determine the plan of study and the research project. Admission to the PhD program in Pathobiology requires the student to have a BS degree or a DVM degree (or equivalent). The program requires 90 credit hours (30 hours research; 60 hours coursework). Up to 30 credit hours from a MS degree or DVM degree may be transferred.

Personal financial planning is a profession that ranks among the most rewarding and fastest growing careers in the country. Individuals and families need assistance to maneuver the complexities of the financial service industry. Personal financial planners guide clients in financial decision-making, helping them achieve their life goals. We are one of the top programs in the country, and we offer a bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, doctoral degree and graduate certificate programs.
Accreditation status: Registered with the Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards Inc.

description: The pet food industry is one of the fastest growing segments of the food industry, and there is a need for trained professionals. The undergraduate certificate in pet food processing provides students with a detailed understanding of the pet food industry, including regulations, food safety and ingredient handling. The program allows students to work with a range of feed industry equipment and teaches them how to safely operate it. This certificate is designed to complement a bachelor’s degree in feed science and management, animal science and industry, grain science, or another discipline.

The Department of Philosophy at Kansas State University offers a master's degree (MA) in philosophy. The program is designed to give students a thorough grounding in the central areas of philosophy, including metaphysics, epistemology, ethics, and the history of philosophy. It is a two-year program, and we generally admit 4-6 students a year.

The master's program in physical science is a broad-based, interdisciplinary program designed for students who wish to pursue a graduate degree that offers a breadth of knowledge in the physical sciences and/or mathematics. This program is particularly beneficial for secondary school teachers who want to be able to teach more than one science or mathematics subject.

Concentration name: Physiology
description: The Department of Anatomy and Physiology offers graduate study leading to the Master of Science and Doctor of Philosophy degrees in the following areas: Anatomy, Physiology, Pharmacology/Toxicology, and Neuroscience. Areas of research emphasis include: cell and developmental biology, immunology, neuroscience, and pharmacology/toxicology.

The Department of Plant Pathology offers graduate work leading to the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. K-State Plant Pathology graduate students have the opportunity to study with some of the world’s leading scientists in the field. Our faculty are recognized internationally for their expertise in areas such as plant genetics and genomics, molecular plant-microbe interactions, plant disease epidemiology and management, and biosecurity/microbial forensics.

The Master of Arts in political science is designed to serve the needs of students with a variety of long-term goals, including those who plan to continue their education in a Ph.D. program, those who plan to attend law school, and those who intend to enter public service immediately upon completing their M.A. degree. The program offers a broad training in the discipline, with students taking courses in American government, comparative politics, international relations and political thought.

error: Invalid operation: The `response.text` quick accessor requires the response to contain a valid `Part`, but none were returned. The candidate's [finish_reason](https://ai.google.dev/api/generate-content#finishreason) is 1.

Concentration name: Behavioral Neuroscience, Cognitive/Human Factors, Industrial/Organizational, and Social/Personality
description: The Department of Psychological Sciences offers graduate work leading to the Doctor of Philosophy degree (Ph.D.) in psychology with an emphasis in behavioral neuroscience, cognitive/human factors, industrial/organizational, and social/personality psychology. We do not offer a terminal master's degree. Our graduate program is designed to provide students with the knowledge, skills, and experience necessary to become successful scholars and researchers.

Concentration name: Public Budgeting and Financial Management; Local Government Management; State and Non-Profit Management
description: The Master of Public Administration (MPA) is a professional degree designed to prepare pre-service and in-service students for careers in the public and non-profit sectors. The MPA program prepares leaders to serve the public interest, particularly at the state and local levels and in the non-profit sector. Our students acquire the skills and knowledge to manage and lead organizations that are diverse, ethical, and effective.
Accreditation status: Network of Schools of Public Policy, Affairs, and Administration (NASPAA)

Concentration name: Food Safety and Biosecurity; Infectious Diseases and Zoonoses; Public Health Nutrition; Public Health Physical Activity
description: The Master of Public Health at Kansas State University is an interdisciplinary program designed to prepare individuals to better understand and address public health issues. The program prepares students for careers in public health, applying knowledge and skills from a variety of disciplines to wellness, disease prevention and health promotion. This 42-credit hour program is designed to provide graduate-level education for individuals currently employed or anticipating a career in public health.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH)

description: The public health core concepts graduate certificate is designed to give you a strong foundation in the five core areas of public health: biostatistics, environmental health sciences, epidemiology, health policy and management, and social and behavioral sciences. This 15-credit-hour program provides a basic and/or refresher education for those currently working in public health or interested in the field. The certificate is a great way to start your Master of Public Health degree. All 15 credit hours may be transferred into the Master of Public Health program at K-State.

Concentration name: Public Horticulture
description: Public horticulture is the art and science of cultivating plants in public spaces for the enjoyment and education of visitors. This specialization provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to manage public gardens, arboreta, and other green spaces. Students in this program have the opportunity to work with faculty on research projects related to public garden management, education, and interpretation.

Regional and community planners work to build strong, resilient communities. Planners help communities make decisions about housing, transportation, parks, economic development, and more. Planners are visionary, broad-minded thinkers who can identify a community’s needs and help it meet them. The Master of Regional & Community Planning (MRCP) is an accredited professional degree. Our program prepares students to become planning practitioners and leaders in the field.
Accreditation status: The Master of Regional & Community Planning (MRCP) is an accredited professional degree.

description: The school counseling master's degree program prepares you to work as a school counselor in pre-K-12 schools. You will learn to design and implement comprehensive school counseling programs that promote equity, access and student success. The program emphasizes: Social-emotional development; Academic achievement; Career development.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Kansas State Department of Education (KSDE) and the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP).

Concentration name: Secondary Education
description: The Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) is an innovative pathway to teaching for those who have previously earned a bachelor’s degree. The MAT is an online graduate program that can be completed in 12 months. The Secondary Track is designed for those who want to teach in middle or high school (grades 6-12) in a specific content area. This track leads to initial teacher licensure.
Accreditation status: The College of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Kansas State Department of Education (KSDE).

description: The Security Studies Program at Kansas State University is an interdisciplinary master’s and doctoral degree program focused on the historical and political study of international security, military affairs, transnational issues, and world politics. The program draws on the expertise of the Department of History and the Department of Political Science, both of which have established reputations for teaching and research in security studies.

The social justice education graduate certificate creates and sustains equitable educational experiences for all students. This 15-credit hour program addresses inequities that select populations face in current educational and community settings. Students will explore the principles of social justice education and the complexities of social identity.
Accreditation status: Kansas State University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission.

Concentration name: Advanced Generalist Practice
description: The Master of Social Work program at K-State is a hybrid program designed to prepare students for advanced generalist social work practice with individuals, families, groups, organizations, and communities. Our program is dedicated to preparing graduates who will work as advanced generalist practitioners in complex settings, exhibiting the highest standards of professional and ethical conduct.
Accreditation status: Accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE)

Concentration name: Criminology; International Development / Social Change; Community / Urban / Rural; Political Sociology / Social Movements
description: The graduate program in sociology at Kansas State University offers advanced training in the analysis of social systems and social change. We offer both the Master of Arts (MA) and Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) degrees. Our graduate program is small and selective, allowing for close faculty-student collaboration. We have a strong record of placing our graduates in academic and applied research positions.

The Master of Science in Software Engineering (MSSE) is a professional master's degree program offered by the Department of Computer Science at Kansas State University. The curriculum is designed to provide students with the skills and knowledge needed to succeed in the software industry. Students will learn about software architecture, testing, and project management, as well as technical skills in areas such as web applications, mobile computing, and cloud computing.

description: The Department of Statistics offers graduate study leading to the Master of Science (M.S.) and Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degrees. The M.S. degree is designed to provide a broad background in statistical theory and application. The Ph.D. degree is a research-oriented degree which prepares students for careers in academia, industry, or government.

The Ph.D. in student affairs in higher education is a 63-credit hour research-oriented program designed for those who wish to work in leadership positions in student affairs and higher education administration. The doctorate is designed to prepare student affairs professionals to assume senior-level leadership positions in colleges and universities. The program emphasizes a high-level of understanding of student development, organizational theory, administrative issues, and research skills to help you succeed as an administrator.

The Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) is an innovative pathway to teaching for those who have a bachelor's degree in a field other than education. This 12-month online program provides an opportunity for students to obtain a master's degree and recommendation for initial Kansas teacher licensure. The MAT is strictly a licensure program; it does not lead to additional endorsements. The program is designed to prepare highly qualified teachers for the state of Kansas and the nation.
Accreditation status: The Professional Education Unit at Kansas State University is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP) and the Kansas State Department of Education (KSDE).

Concentration name: Teaching and Learning
description: The teaching and learning area of emphasis is designed for students interested in the general field of curriculum and instruction. This emphasis allows students to design a program of study that meets their specific interests and career goals. Students work closely with their major professor and supervisory committee to select courses that will prepare them for their desired career path.

The Teaching English as a Second Language (TESL) graduate certificate program prepares you to teach in postsecondary intensive English programs, adult education programs or as a resource specialist in K-12. This 15-credit-hour program provides a foundation in the second-language acquisition process, as well as strategies for teaching and assessing English language proficiency. It can be completed as a stand-alone credential or applied toward the Master of Arts in Second Language Acquisition.
Program name: Teaching English as a Second Language

Concentration name: Drama Therapy
description: The Drama Therapy program at Kansas State University is an accredited master's program in theatre with a concentration in drama therapy. We offer students the opportunity to learn, experience, and practice drama therapy in the heart of the Midwest.
Accreditation status: Approved by the North American Drama Therapy Association

description: The veterinary biomedical science program is a broad, interdisciplinary field focused on the biology of animals and the mechanisms of disease processes. The program emphasizes research in basic and applied biomedical sciences, clinical investigations and public health.

Kansas State University offers the course VM 812 – Veterinary Forensics: Animal Crime Scene Processing. This course is designed to provide veterinarians, veterinary technicians, law enforcement officers, animal control officers and others involved in animal cruelty investigations with the knowledge and skills necessary to process an animal crime scene. Students will learn how to recognize, document, collect and preserve evidence from an animal crime scene.
Accreditation status: Approved by the Registry of Approved Continuing Education (RACE)

description: The Master of Public Health (MPH) degree is an interdisciplinary program of the College of Agriculture, College of Arts and Sciences, College of Health and Human Sciences, and College of Veterinary Medicine at Kansas State University. The program is designed to provide graduate-level education for individuals currently employed or anticipating a career in public health. The curriculum provides a broad based education in the core areas of public health, as well as specialized training in one of four emphasis areas.
Accreditation status: The MPH program is accredited by the Council on Education for Public Health (CEPH).

description: The online master’s in youth development prepares you for a career in youth-serving organizations such as 4-H, Boys and Girls Clubs of America, non-profits, faith-based groups, community recreation, juvenile justice facilities and more. This program relies on a science-based curriculum to help you gain the knowledge and skills to create and effectively manage youth development programs.
Accreditation status: Kansas State University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission of the North Central Association of Colleges and Schools.

description: The youth program development and evaluation graduate certificate prepares students to assess the success of youth programs. You will learn to determine the impact of programs on youth and their families and communities.
